gallery_slide.gallery_image_caption: Cleveland Clinic, the non-profit network of hospitals and research facilities, commissioned Catherine Opie to create 22 images of Lake Erie in all four seasons. Above: “Summer, Untitled 19.”
Cleveland Clinic, the non-profit network of hospitals and research facilities, commissioned Catherine Opie to create 22 images of Lake Erie in all four seasons. Above: “Fall, Untitled 2.“
Cleveland Clinic, the non-profit network of hospitals and research facilities, commissioned Catherine Opie to create 22 images of Lake Erie in all four seasons. Above: “Fall, Untitled 3.”
Catherine Opie’s images installed in Hillcrest Hospital.

gallery_slide.gallery_image_credit: © DOUG KEYES/COURTESY KLOMPCHING GALLERY, NEW YORK
gallery_slide.gallery_image_caption: Doug Keyes’s image of Noonday Demon, created as a commission for author Andrew Solomon, became part of the photographer’s “Collective Memory” series of multiple-exposure images of books.

gallery_slide.gallery_image_credit: © JESSICA TODD HARPER/COURTESY RICK WESTER FINE ART, NEW YORK
gallery_slide.gallery_image_caption: “Evelyn,” 2015 by Jessica Todd Harper, who has exhibited and sold images of her own family. Collectors have frequently commissioned her to make family portraits.

gallery_slide.gallery_image_credit: © JESSICA TODD HARPER/COURTESY RICK WESTER FINE ART, NEW YORK
gallery_slide.gallery_image_caption: “Sophia and Barbara,” 2012. The image was commissioned by a collector, and was included in Jessica Todd Harper’s recent exhibition, “The Home Stage.”

gallery_slide.gallery_image_credit: © JESSICA TODD HARPER/COURTESY RICK WESTER FINE ART, NEW YORK
gallery_slide.gallery_image_caption: Another commissioned portrait, “Husch and Her Daugher,” 2009.
